history.content: If you're taking one class in the fall and then the other one concurrently the following spring with 189, definitely take 126 in the fall and then 189 + 127 in the following spring. I cannot stress enough how much better this is (for most people if not everyone) than taking 127 in the fall and then 189 + 126 in the following spring

If you're taking one class in the fall and then the other one concurrently the following spring with 189, definitely take 126 in the fall and then 189 + 127 in yer following spring. I cannot stress enough how much better this is (for most people if not everyone) than taking 127 in the fall and then 189 + 126 in the following spring

children.subject:
Sure, I’ll give you a summary. One thing I’ll clarify first is that I took prob 140 in Fall 2019 with Professor Adhikari, and eecs 127 + CS 189 with Professor Ranade and Shewchuk respectively in Spring 2020. I think my advice generalise across semesters reasonably well but it’s also useful to know where I’m coming from

With 127 and 189, there’s a lot of overlap in content where you basically learn the same thing twice ie in both classes. I remember at one point I had identical questions about PSD matrices on both my eecs 127 and CS 189 HW that week. There were also times when you’d learn a topic in one class first and then you were well equipped when you saw it in the other 

In comparison, a lot of Prob 140/EECS 126 content isn’t directly useful to 189 in the same way, but you need rigorous probabilistic thinking. You want to make sure you understand the big pictures of the algorithms rather than getting caught up in the details, and 140/126 equips you for exactly that. A strong foundation in probability means you don’t get up on those details.

Does that help?
@Ishaan, I will take your advice.  Could you please explain a bit why.  Not that I don't believe you, I just would like to understand a bit more of the reasoning behind your advice.

history.content: <md>I'm planning to take EECS 126/127 next year and plan to take 189 in spring. I was wondering if I should take 126 or 127 before 189? I've heard some people say that 127 and 189 together are a good combination since a lot of the material for both classes complement each other nicely but some people also said that taking 126 can give a good foundation on probability before entering 189. I've taken 70 and 16B this semester and have found the probability side of 70 to be quite interesting but I also enjoyed some of the linear algebra applications in 16B. I want to explore topics in probability in more depth but at the same time, I'm not sure if it will be better to take 127 concurrently with 189 in spring and take 126 in fall. I'd appreciate any advice on how I should go about selecting which class to take first. Thanks!</md>
history.subject: EECS 126 or EECS 127 before 189?
